data.name: Team Magma's Numel
data.flavorText: No matter how heavy the cargo, we can transport it to our destination with ease, thanks to Numel.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma's Camerupt
data.flavorText: Camerupt, with its strength against fire, played a big role in rescuing team members.

abilities.name: Burning Draft
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fighting or Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Team Aqua's Spheal
data.flavorText: Spheal's Water Gun can put out any fire. Flames used by opponents have no effect!

data.name: Team Aqua's Sealeo
data.flavorText: It provides support by making paths of ice. It can win any battle as long as it's on ice.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hail Storm
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Team Magma Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Team Aqua's Muk
data.flavorText: It immobilizes its opponents by wrapping them in its huge, poisonous body. It'll smoosh you, too!

abilities.name: Sludge Festival
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each Pokémon in play (except for Team Aqua Pokémon) is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Team Aqua's Walrein
data.flavorText: It's good at attacks that freeze opponents with a powerful cold snap. Then, it pulverizes a frozen foe with its sharp tusks!

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Blizzard
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Team Aqua's Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Aqua Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Team Aqua's Grimer
data.flavorText: Its flexible body, which allows it to squeeze into any cracks, comes in handy when invading enemy hideouts.

data.name: Team Aqua's Seviper
data.flavorText: Seviper's tail is a sharp blade. It can even poison you!

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venom Tail
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma's Baltoy
data.flavorText: They all cry out at once to let us know when they spot an enemy. It really helps out!

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Team Magma's Claydol
data.flavorText: Claydol's beam can seize opponents and keep them from moving. Long-range attacks are its specialty!

abilities.name: Magma Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your Team Magma Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma's Aron
data.flavorText: Aron, which even devour metal, can eat and destroy enemy ships in an instant.

data.name: Team Magma's Aggron
data.flavorText: Aggron's metal horns can smash through any defenses, no matter how strong!

attacks.name: Rock Stomp
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fighting Energy you discarded.

attacks.name: Boulder Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Team Magma's Groudon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Magma Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Magma Quake
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Team Magma's Lairon
data.flavorText: When Lairon uses Take Down, the impact from its solid body is enough to destroy concrete!

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Team Aqua's Poochyena
data.flavorText: Poochyena can easily detect invading foes with its acute sense of smell. It's an excellent lookout!

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma's Poochyena
data.flavorText: Poochyena's nose can identify any scent. It's very useful for reconnaissance.

attacks.name: Infiltrate
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

data.name: Team Aqua's Carvanha
data.flavorText: You can't keep up with its movements underwater, can you? If you get caught in this whirlpool, there'll be no escape.

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Team Aqua's Mightyena
data.flavorText: Thanks to Mightyena's outstanding leadership, it's very good at combination attacks that can leave a foe helpless.

attacks.name: Teampact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Team Aqua Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma's Mightyena
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is loyal to its master. It will protect its partner to the end, no matter what.

attacks.name: Hostile Fang
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Team Aqua Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Team Magma's Zangoose
data.flavorText: Can you handle the formation attack of the fearless Zangoose?

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Team Magma Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Play
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Team Magma Pokémon on your Bench.

data.name: Aqua Diffuser
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Team Aqua Pokémon this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Aqua Diffuser
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Team Aqua Admin
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Team Aqua Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Magma Pointer
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Team Magma Pokémon this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Magma Pointer
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Team Aqua's Sharpedo
data.flavorText: It boasts fangs so powerful that they knock opponents out in one shot! Enemies that slip up will be taken down without fail!

abilities.name: Aqua Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Team Aqua Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Team Aqua's Great Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Team Aqua Pokémon and a basic Water Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Aqua Grunt
rules: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card, you can't play this card.) Draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Team Aqua Pokémon, draw 1 more card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Aqua's Secret Base
rules: The Retreat Cost of each Pokémon in play (except for Team Aqua Pokémon) is Colorless more.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Team Magma's Great Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Team Magma Pokémon and a basic Fighting Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Magma Grunt
rules: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card, you can't play this card.) Draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Team Magma Pokémon, draw 1 more card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Magma Admin
rules: Put up to 3 Team Magma Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Team Magma's Secret Base
rules: Whenever any player puts a Basic Pokémon (except for Team Magma Pokémon) from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Double Aqua Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Team Aqua Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of the turn you attached it.
This card provides WaterWater Energy only while it is attached to a Team Aqua Pokémon.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Team Aqua Pokémon, discard this card.)

data.name: Double Magma Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Team Magma Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of the turn you attached it.
This card provides FightingFighting Energy only while it is attached to a Team Magma Pokémon.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Team Magma Pokémon, discard this card.)
